com.google.appinventor.components.runtime

Class Sprite

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.appinventor.components.runtime.VisibleComponent
      • com.google.appinventor.components.runtime.Sprite
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AlarmHandler, Component, Deleteable, OnDestroyListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Ball, ImageSprite

    public abstract class Sprite
extends VisibleComponent
implements AlarmHandler, OnDestroyListener, Deleteable
    Superclass of sprites able to move and interact with other sprites. While the Simple programmer sees the x- and y-coordinates as integers, they are maintained internally as doubles so fractional changes (caused by multiplying the speed by a cosine or sine value) have the chance to add up.
    Author:
    spertus.google.com (Ellen Spertus)

        protected double zLayer

      • speed

        protected float speed

      • userHeading

        protected double userHeading
        The angle, in degrees above the positive x-axis, specified by the user. This is private in order to enforce that changing it also changes heading, headingRadians, headingCos, and headingSin.

      • heading

        protected double heading
        The angle, in degrees below the positive x-axis, specified by the user. We use this to compute new coordinates because, on Android, the y-coordinate increases "below" the x-axis.

      • headingRadians

        protected double headingRadians

      • headingCos

        protected double headingCos

      • headingSin

        protected double headingSin

      • Sprite

        protected Sprite(ComponentContainer container,
      Handler handler)
        Creates a new Sprite component. This version exists to allow injection of a mock handler for testing.
        Parameters:
        container - where the component will be placed
        handler - a scheduler to which runnable events will be posted

      • Sprite

        protected Sprite(ComponentContainer container)
        Creates a new Sprite component. This is called by the constructors of concrete subclasses, such as Ball and ImageSprite.
        Parameters:
        container - where the component will be placed

        Enabled property setter method: starts or stops the timer.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true starts the timer, false stops it

      • Heading

        public void Heading(double userHeading)
        Sets heading in which sprite should move. In addition to changing the local variables userHeading and heading, this sets headingCos, headingSin, and headingRadians.
        Parameters:
        userHeading - degrees above the positive x-axis

        Sets the speed with which this sprite should move.
        Parameters:
        speed - the magnitude (in pixels) to move every interval milliseconds

      • Z

        public void Z(double layer)
        Sets the layer of the sprite, indicating whether it will appear in front of or behind other sprites.
        Parameters:
        layer - higher numbers indicate that this sprite should appear in front of ones with lower numbers; if values are equal for sprites, either can go in front of the other

      • Z

        public double Z()

      • postEvent

        protected void postEvent(Sprite sprite,
             String eventName,
             Object... args)
        Posts a dispatch for the specified event. This guarantees that event handlers run with serial semantics, e.g., appear atomic relative to each other. This method is overridden in tests.
        Parameters:
        sprite - the instance on which the event takes place
        eventName - the name of the event
        args - the arguments to the event handler

      • CollidedWith

        public void CollidedWith(Sprite other)
        Handler for CollidedWith events, called when two sprites collide. Note that checking for collisions with a rotated ImageSprite currently checks against the sprite's unrotated position. Therefore, collision checking will be inaccurate for tall narrow or short wide sprites that are rotated.
        Parameters:
        other - the other sprite in the collision

      • Dragged

        public void Dragged(float startX,
           float startY,
           float prevX,
           float prevY,
           float currentX,
           float currentY)
        Handler for Dragged events. On all calls, the starting coordinates are where the screen was first touched, and the "current" coordinates describe the endpoint of the current line segment. On the first call within a given drag, the "previous" coordinates are the same as the starting coordinates; subsequently, they are the "current" coordinates from the prior call. Note that the Sprite won't actually move anywhere in response to the Dragged event unless MoveTo is specifically called.
        Parameters:
        startX - the starting x-coordinate
        startY - the starting y-coordinate
        prevX - the previous x-coordinate (possibly equal to startX)
        prevY - the previous y-coordinate (possibly equal to startY)
        currentX - the current x-coordinate
        currentY - the current y-coordinate

      • EdgeReached

        public void EdgeReached(int edge)
        Event handler called when the sprite reaches an edge of the screen. If Bounce is then called with that edge, the sprite will appear to bounce off of the edge it reached.

      • NoLongerCollidingWith

        public void NoLongerCollidingWith(Sprite other)
        Handler for NoLongerCollidingWith events, called when a pair of sprites cease colliding. This also registers the removal of the collision to a private variable registeredCollisions so that CollidedWith(Sprite) and this event are only raised once per beginning and ending of a collision.
        Parameters:
        other - the sprite formerly colliding with this sprite

      • Touched

        public void Touched(float x,
           float y)
        When the user touches the sprite and then immediately lifts finger: provides the (x,y) position of the touch, relative to the upper left of the canvas
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate of touched point
        y - y-coordinate of touched point

      • Flung

        public void Flung(float x,
         float y,
         float speed,
         float heading,
         float xvel,
         float yvel)
        When a fling gesture (quick swipe) is made on the sprite: provides the (x,y) position of the start of the fling, relative to the upper left of the canvas. Also provides the speed (pixels per millisecond) and heading (0-360 degrees) of the fling, as well as the x velocity and y velocity components of the fling's vector.
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate of touched point
        y - y-coordinate of touched point * @param speed the speed of the fling sqrt(xspeed^2 + yspeed^2)
        heading - the heading of the fling
        xvel - the speed in x-direction of the fling
        yvel - the speed in y-direction of the fling

      • TouchUp

        public void TouchUp(float x,
           float y)
        When the user stops touching the sprite (lifts finger after a TouchDown event): provides the (x,y) position of the touch, relative to the upper left of the canvas
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate of touched point
        y - y-coordinate of touched point

      • TouchDown

        public void TouchDown(float x,
             float y)
        When the user begins touching the sprite (places finger on sprite and leaves it there): provides the (x,y) position of the touch, relative to the upper left of the canvas
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate of touched point
        y - y-coordinate of touched point

      • Bounce

        public void Bounce(int edge)
        Makes this sprite bounce, as if off of a wall by changing the heading (unless the sprite is not traveling toward the specified direction). This also calls MoveIntoBounds() in case the sprite is out of bounds.
        Parameters:
        edge - the direction of the object (real or imaginary) to bounce off of; this should be one of Component.DIRECTION_NORTH, Component.DIRECTION_NORTHEAST, Component.DIRECTION_EAST, Component.DIRECTION_SOUTHEAST, Component.DIRECTION_SOUTH, Component.DIRECTION_SOUTHWEST, Component.DIRECTION_WEST, or Component.DIRECTION_NORTHWEST.

      • CollidingWith

        public boolean CollidingWith(Sprite other)
        Indicates whether a collision has been registered between this sprite and the passed sprite.
        Parameters:
        other - the sprite to check for collision with this sprite
        Returns:
        true if a collision event has been raised for the pair of sprites and they still are in collision, false otherwise.

      • MoveIntoBounds

        public void MoveIntoBounds()
        Moves the sprite back in bounds if part of it extends out of bounds, having no effect otherwise. If the sprite is too wide to fit on the canvas, this aligns the left side of the sprite with the left side of the canvas. If the sprite is too tall to fit on the canvas, this aligns the top side of the sprite with the top side of the canvas.

      • MoveTo

        public void MoveTo(double x,
          double y)
        Moves sprite directly to specified point.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate
        y - the y-coordinate

      • PointTowards

        public void PointTowards(Sprite target)
        Turns this sprite to point towards a given other sprite.
        Parameters:
        target - the other sprite to point towards

      • PointInDirection

        public void PointInDirection(double x,
                    double y)
        Turns this sprite to point towards a given point.
        Parameters:
        x - parameter of the point to turn to
        y - parameter of the point to turn to

      • registerChange

        protected void registerChange()
        Responds to a move or change of this sprite by redrawing the enclosing Canvas and checking for any consequences that need handling. Specifically, this (1) notifies the Canvas of a change so it can detect any collisions, etc., and (2) raises the EdgeReached(int) event if the Sprite has reached the edge of the Canvas.

      • hitEdge

        protected int hitEdge()
        Specifies which edge of the canvas has been hit by the Sprite, if any, moving the sprite back in bounds.
        Returns:
        Component.DIRECTION_NONE if no edge has been hit, or a direction (e.g., Component.DIRECTION_NORTHEAST) if that edge of the canvas has been hit

      • moveIntoBounds

        protected final void moveIntoBounds(int canvasWidth,
                  int canvasHeight)
        Moves the sprite back in bounds if part of it extends out of bounds, having no effect otherwise. If the sprite is too wide to fit on the canvas, this aligns the left side of the sprite with the left side of the canvas. If the sprite is too tall to fit on the canvas, this aligns the top side of the sprite with the top side of the canvas.

      • updateCoordinates

        protected void updateCoordinates()
        Updates the x- and y-coordinates based on the heading and speed. The caller is responsible for calling registerChange().

      • hitEdge

        protected int hitEdge(int canvasWidth,
          int canvasHeight)

      • getBoundingBox

        public BoundingBox getBoundingBox(int border)
        Provides the bounding box for this sprite. Modifying the returned value does not affect the sprite.
        Parameters:
        border - the number of pixels outside the sprite to include in the bounding box
        Returns:
        the bounding box for this sprite

      • colliding

        public static boolean colliding(Sprite sprite1,
                Sprite sprite2)
        Determines whether two sprites are in collision. Note that we cannot merely see whether the rectangular regions around each intersect, since some types of sprite, such as BallSprite, are not rectangular.
        Parameters:
        sprite1 - one sprite
        sprite2 - another sprite
        Returns:
        true if they are in collision, false otherwise

      • intersectsWith

        public boolean intersectsWith(BoundingBox rect)
        Determines whether this sprite intersects with the given rectangle.
        Parameters:
        rect - the rectangle
        Returns:
        true if they intersect, false otherwise

      • containsPoint

        public boolean containsPoint(double qx,
                    double qy)
        Indicates whether the specified point is contained by this sprite. Subclasses of Sprite that are not rectangular should override this method.
        Parameters:
        qx - the x-coordinate
        qy - the y-coordinate
        Returns:
        whether (qx, qy) falls within this sprite
